definition: (neologism c. 2014) irresistibly quirky/compelling in its wackiness
devil/magic
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: At the same time, Shafei has the devil character to save herself .
sentences.chinese: 同时，莎菲又有自救反抗的魔性。

sentences.english: Devilism is the vital cause that shapes a character's fate.
sentences.chinese: 魔性是导致人物悲剧的重要原因。

sentences.english: So yeah, she probably won't break a sweat playing an enchanted wardrobe.
sentences.chinese: 所以呢，她演一个魔性衣柜大概不费吹灰之力吧。

sentences.english: Mysterious and devious looking equipment bubbling . I wonder what they are making?
sentences.chinese: 神秘的魔性装置冒着气泡，不知道他们在做什么？

definition: (neologism) (of movies, songs etc) affecting/touching/moving/(of a person, esp. a woman) charming/cool
(slang) to battle each other in street dancing (derived from Taiwanese 較, which sounds similar to Mandarin 尬[ga4])/(slang) to perform weird dance moves
to get people to laugh/funny/hilarious
(slang) cool/awesome
comicality/comical/(Buddhism) joy
The Divine Comedy by Dante Alighieri 但丁
medicated leaven (used in TCM to treat indigestion)
(slang) silly but amusing person
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
(of a spirit or deity) to possess sb
to do sth wacky/wacky/wacky behavior
spoof (web-based genre in PRC, acquiring cult status from 2005, involving humorous, satirical or fantastical videos, photo collections, texts, poems etc)
image macro/visual meme/sticker package/emoticon collection
endearingly silly
to entice/to charm
silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to burst out laughing/hilarious/burst of laughter
